sentences: The arresting officer reported that he smelled marijuana and saw smoke through the open door of the bus after he had stopped and pulled over the bus.

sentences: The driver of the bus shut the door and told officers he was not authorized to allow them on the bus.
section: == Legal issues ==

sentences: The officer said the marijuana smell gave him probable cause to search, but the driver refused to open the door.
section: == Legal issues ==

sentences: After many attempts to enter, the bus was towed with the men still aboard to the police training center in Oklahoma City.
section: == Legal issues ==

sentences: Officers obtained a search warrant and the 10 men, including Epps, got off the bus.
section: == Legal issues ==

sentences: Police discovered two semi-automatic pistols and a 12-gauge pump shotgun, along with some prescription painkillers and marijuana residue, on the tour bus according to papers filed Oklahoma County district Court.
section: == Legal issues ==

== The Real University ==

sentences: The Real University ==
section: == The Real University ==

sentences: On January 6, 2015, 2 Chainz announced that he was starting his own independent record label "The Real University" (also known as "T.R.U."; or "The Real U").
section: == The Real University ==

sentences: The announcement also revealed that frequent collaborators Cap.1 & Skooly were signed.
section: == The Real University ==

sentences: Additionally, they signed former Young Money artist Short Dawg, who is now known as Fresh.
section: == The Real University ==

sentences: Along with the announcement of the label's founding, they also revealed they'd be releasing their debut mixtape TRU Jack City on January 27, 2015.
section: == The Real University ==

sentences: On October 4, 2019, 2 Chainz announced that T.R. U has signed a partnership deal with Atlantic Records.
section: == The Real University ==
